glsa.title: ISC DHCP: dhcpclient Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow in dhclient as included in the ISC DHCP implementation allows for the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.

background.p: ISC DHCP is the reference implementation of the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol as specified in RFC 2131.

description.p: The Mandriva Linux Engineering Team has reported a stack-based buffer overflow in the subnet-mask handling of dhclient.

impact.p: A remote attacker might set up a rogue DHCP server in a victim's local network, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
